title: Service Performance Report - Standard
description: This Workflow generates Service Performance reports and emails to the specified addresses.
guide:
# Service Performance Report
Get a list of your top Services. This Workflow queries Grail and sends email(s) of your choice.

# Setup
1. Change emails (`to`, `cc`, `bcc`) to be an array of strings.
2. Test with a manual Run, by click the `Run` button.
3. If everything works as expected, change the [Trigger](?trigger=) to a schedule, e.g. Weekly, Daily, etc.

# More advanced interactions
Consider using our MCP server, [local](https://github.com/dynatrace-oss/dynatrace-mcp) or [remote](https://docs.dynatrace.com/docs/discover-dynatrace/platform/davis-ai/dynatrace-mcp ).

tenant.name: tenant

input.query:
fetch dt.entity.environment
| fields URL=concat("[Open in Dynatrace](http://",dt.system.environment,".apps.dynatrace.com/ui/apps/dynatrace.services/explorer?perspective=performance&sort=healthIndicators%3Adescending)")
| limit 1

tenant.description: Make use of Dynatrace Grail data in your workflow.

service_performance.name: service_performance

input.query:
timeseries {p50 = median(dt.service.request.response_time),
           p90 = percentile(dt.service.request.response_time, 90),
           p99 = percentile(dt.service.request.response_time, 99),
           requests = sum(dt.service.request.count), 
           errors = sum(dt.service.request.failure_count)},
           by:{dt.entity.service}
| fieldsAdd p50 = round(arrayAvg(p50)/1000, decimals: 2),
            p90 = round(arrayAvg(p90)/1000, decimals: 2),
            p99 = round(arrayAvg(p99)/1000, decimals: 2),
            Requests = arraySum(requests), 
            Failures = arraySum(errors)
| fieldsAdd FailureRate = (Failures/Requests) *100
| fieldsAdd Service = entityName(dt.entity.service)
| filterOut isNull(Service)
| fields Service,
         Requests,
         `p50(ms)` = p50,
         `p90(ms)` = p90,
         `p99(ms)` = p99,
         FailureRate,
         Failures
| sort `p50(ms)` desc
| limit 25

service_performance.description: Make use of Dynatrace Grail data in your workflow.
